greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Triangle read by rows: T(n,k) is the number of graphs with n vertices and maximum vertex degree k, (0 <= k < n).
comment: Terms may be computed without generating each graph by enumerating the number of graphs by degree sequence. A PARI program showing this technique for graphs with labeled vertices is given in A327366. Burnside's lemma can be used to extend this method to the unlabeled case. - _Andrew Howroyd_, Mar 10 2020
link: Andrew Howroyd, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..210 (first 20 rows)
FindStat - Combinatorial Statistic Finder, The degree of a graph
Eric Weisstein's World of Mathematics, Maximum Vertex Degree
formula: G.f. for column k=2: 1/((1-x)(1-x^2))*Product_{i>=3} 1/(1-x^i)^2 - B(x) - A(x).
T(n, k) = A294217(n, n - 1 - k). - _Andrew Howroyd_, Sep 03 2019
xref: Row sums are A000088 (simple graphs on n nodes).
Cf. A294217 (triangle of n-node minimum vertex degree counts).
results.author: _Christian Stump_, Oct 13 2015
ext: Rows n=9 and 10 added by _Eric W. Weisstein_, Oct 24 2017
